intro: Lasianthus wallichii var. setosus, commonly known as the hairy lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive hairy foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine, soft hairs. The flowers are usually clustered in spikes and can range in color from white to pink, attracting various pollinators.
